ai.summary: Killyclougher Burn Walk is a short, easy riverside stroll in the UK, covering about 1.8 km along the Killyclougher Burn. It's suitable for families, casual walkers and those seeking a gentle outdoor experience with pleasant water views.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly flat and easy underfoot with gravel and compact earth paths running alongside the burn. Expect occasional grassy patches and potential mud after rain; some sections may be wet near the water's edge.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy footwear and stay on marked paths. Keep children and dogs under control away from steep riverbanks. Be cautious of slippery surfaces after rain and watch for cyclists on shared sections. Carry a light layer and water; daylight hours are shorter in winter. Mobile signal can be patchy in remote sections.
recommended_gear: Comfortable walking shoes or light boots
Hat and sunscreen for sunny days
Extra warm layer for cooler weather
Phone with offline map or simple map
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn; the route is accessible year-round but usually drier and more pleasant in mild, dry conditions.

seo.title: Killyclougher Burn Walk - Easy 1.8 km Riverside Trail in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore a gentle 1.8 km riverside walk along Killyclougher Burn. An easy, family-friendly trail in the UK with practical safety tips and gear suggestions.
